title: [Large-scale] Flipped Learning-Based Mathematical Problem-Solving Ability Improvement Course

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Mathematical Concepts and Proficiency in Online Learning Tools
context.additional_context: Aims to cultivate mathematics teaching competencies in flipped learning environments for pre-service teachers and education job seekers. A process combining real-time interaction and self-directed learning in digitally equipped environments

learning_goals: Learners complete 80% or more of pre-class materials (videos/readings) in the flipped learning model to achieve readiness for class participation.
Learners apply three or more math problem-solving strategies presented during real-time discussions and collaborative activities.
Learners achieve 85+ points on summative assessments to demonstrate applied understanding of concepts acquired in a flipped learning environment.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
